text:
Servlets invoked from JSP or html pages with a call that includes information 
being passed to the servlet via an http GET request do not have access to init 
parameters defined in web.xml.

So, for example, if I initially call a servlet via an http request like

mycoolsite.com/servlet/myservlet?myparameter=62

the servlet fires up, the init method is called, and within that init method if 
I now try to access init parameters defined in web.xml, these parameters are 
returned as nulls. On the other hand, if I call the servlet via

mycoolsite.com/servlet/myservlet

init parameters defined in web.xml are returned normally.
creator: tboyd@ucar.edu

text:
Please attach a WAR file that can reproduce the problem. It may be related with
the previous bug, i.e. the invoker may not recognize the servlet as the one
defined in web.xml - the invoker is tomcat-specific, not part of the spec, so
please try also to use an explicit mapping in web.xml ( that should either
resolve the problem or reveal a spec compliance bug that must be fixed )
